alert.note: Alert for Allen; Barren; Metcalfe; Monroe; Warren (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 5:31PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Monroe, central Allen, southeastern Warren, Barren and southwestern Metcalfe Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 430 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southwest of Glasgow, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Metcalfe, western Monroe, southeastern Warren, central Allen and Barren Counties, including the following locations... Red Cross, Haywood, Austin, Settle, Raley Ford, Martinsville, Fountain Run, Kino, Kepler and Oil City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
